explains: adj. 高调的；备受瞩目的；知名度高的

sentences.en: Tony has now been thrust into the limelight, with a high-profile job.
sentences.cn: 托尼有一份令人注目的工作，现在已成为人们关注的焦点。

sentences.en: Every year a few colleges and universities in the US attract attention because they've managed to book high-profile speakers.
sentences.cn: 美国每年都有一些学院和大学引人注目，因为他们成功地邀请到了著名的演讲者。

sentences.en: Even the technology press conferences, which have been high-profile in the past and reached a level of drama and theatrics fitting for a Las Vegas stage, have a different bent to them.
sentences.cn: 即便是过去备受瞩目、达到了适合拉斯维加斯舞台的戏剧效果的科技新闻发布会，如今也对此有了不同的倾向。
